Creek and Back River will follow that design/construction
order.

detention pond will be constructed for quantity and quality

Demolish existing facilities and construct a new

Upgrade Museum exhibits to include more interactive

Expansion to include a floating pier with electrical and water
hook-ups capable of mooring 24 transient recreational

restroom facilities at Mill Point Park, adjacent to the public

A/E services to study each of Hampton's 20 watersheds in an

reduce flooding and storm water pollution.
Installation of additional lighting from the Hampton Roads

column3: The Hampton Public Safety Center will be constructed on six
acres located behind Fire Station 9 and adjacent to the
softball fields inside Briarfield Park. This new facility will
enable the division to provide training to personnel at one
primary location.

Purchase and customize the exteriors of two (2) 24-
passenger buses and one (1) 42-passenger bus to be used
to support activities and demand for services
An automated Vehicle Locating System would allow
managers in Public Works to track service vehicles and
dispatch them more efficiently. Service vehicles would
include Solid Waste vehicles, snow plows, street sweepers,
wastewater clean out vehicles and other similar type
applications.
Public Works Traffic presently has over 64 miles of fiber optic
cable in the City. Most of it is located on utility poles and by
agreement with these utilities, it is used exclusively for traffic
purposes. This project would relocate the fiber optic cable in
3 key areas of the City from overhead poles to underground
conduit locations. This will allow its use for purposes other
than traffic.

column3: System to rapidly and efficiently process applicant
identification (employment, sex offender, concealed weapons,
and foster care) with results returning in hours rather than
weeks or months.
Purchase 26 rugged mobile data computers (MDC) that are
mounted on first responder emergency vehicles. These units
will improve daily operations; provide secure incident
command coordination and data communications capability
for an incident manager, and include an automatic vehicle
locator component that will interface with our computer aided
dispatch (CAD) software.
Outfit current fleet of police vehicles with computers and
peripherals necessary to give officers the ability to complete
reports from the vehicle. The peripherals will include a GPS
system and also increase the speed of connections.
Construct a 15,000 square foot fire station including design,

and data, furniture, fixtures and equipment and land
acquisition.
Provide Uniformed Patrol Officers with a (Smith & Wesson /
Cold / Bushmaster) .223 cal Patrol Rifle. These rifles will
replace the Police shotgun and provide a more accurate
weapon best suited for our urban environment. This request
is partially funded in the FY09-13 CIP.
Purchase replacement vehicles for Uniform Patrol and
Investigative Services.
Install heavy duty washers and dryers in each station to
facilitate cleaning protective clothing after each use, and
every 6 months; required for compliance with NFPA 1851.
Purchase 140 cylinders for the Self-Contained Breathing
Apparatus (SCBA) to serve as a back up for each SCBA

Capital Improvement Plan

column9: TOTAL

column3: DESCRIPTION

column9: REQUEST

column3: A facility is required for the Special Investigations
Units/Peninsula Narcotic Enforcement Task Force for
operational purposes. A new 4,200 square foot facility will
have the capacity to house the Special Investigation Unit,
Crime Analysis Unit, Intelligence Unit, and the Peninsula
Narcotic Enforcement Task Force. The facility will also
provide adequate space for the construction of a vehicle
impound lot to house seized motor vehicles.
Construct an additional engine bay to house reserve engines
& ambulances inside the station to ensure apparatus security
& protection from the elements.
Construct an additional engine bay to house reserve engines
& ambulances inside the station to ensure apparatus security
& protection from the elements.
75 sets of new fire turnout gear. A portion of the new gear
will replace old & worn out gear currently being used by our
volunteer firefighters. The remaining sets of gear will be
appropriated for new volunteer firefighters as they become
members of the volunteer organization.
Purchase a new water tanker which will have a minimum
water capacity of 3,000 gallons and will meet all applicable
requirements of the National Fire Protection Association.
This vehicle will increase the Fire Division's fire suppression
capabilities by providing a sustainable & reliable water supply
resulting in a reduced ISO rating from a 4 to a 2.
This request is required if redevelopment efforts dictate.
Current weapon system (Smith and Wesson) is outdated
because they have stopped regular production and come out
with a new product line. Weapons that are currently ordered
are coming in with poor quality controls. Parts that are
ordered are not being made to the original specifications.
TOTAL: Public Safety
Capital Improvement Plan
Contingency List

column9: TOTAL

column3: DESCRIPTION

column9: REQUEST

column3: Continuation of the Commander Sheppard Boulevard
Extension from the intersection with North Campus Parkway
to the intersection with Big Bethel Road and Saunders Road.
Addition of a traffic signal at the Hampton Roads Center
North Campus.
Replace damaged curbs, sidewalks and eliminate unused
aprons from city owned properties.
Widen Little Back River Road from King Street to Clemwood
Parkway. The widened section will be a four-lane divided
roadway. The requested funding is for design and right-of-
way acquisition. Additional funds will be needed for
construction of Phase 2 (construction from Clemwood
Parkway to Harris Creek Road.)
New street connecting the Pasture Point and Bright's Creek
areas.
The addition of pavement width to accommodate left turn
lanes on eastbound and westbound Pembroke Avenue. A
new mast arm traffic signal and pedestrian signals will be
constructed.
Install a safety fence on the bridge crossing Interstate I-64.
New street connecting the ramp from I-64 to King Street.
Connect Wine Street through to the proposed Honor Park
and to Pembroke Ave.
